title: bncs-gpi_driver
description: This is the project for the executable that runs in the BNCS (or Colledia Control) specified GPI-96 crate, recovered from the CVS repository archive, where it was under Drivers/Colledia/GPICrate. Although it is not strictly speaking a driver that seems to be the least inappropriate category to put it in. It is a Borland project, though at this stage in its life it may be that only the exe is of interest and we may not need any further building of it.

title: tsl-umdsym-old
description: This is some older history for the tsl-umdsym project. The CVS repo that tsl-umdsym was read from only has history for the last version. This was a different part of the CVS history and appears to hold some earlier versions, though not clearly. It would seem that the newer repo was set-up without this. Ideally I'd have brought all this together into some nice linear history, but that isn't proving to be easy, and may not be particularly useful, so here it is as a separate Git repo.

title: tsl-umdsym-TEMP
description: This repo is DEAD - see code (now merged) in: tsl-umdsym

title: tunings_driver
description: The tecnopoint-tunings driver communicates via TCP to the Tecnopoint Tuning-S software. Commands are used to call Sequences Presets which have been set up on the TuningS software. Sequence status updates can also be requested, as well as an Emergency Stop.
